The claim made by Jim Lampley during the: Pacquiao fight is "larger than the annual GDP of 29 different countries."
The World Bank: which tracks global financial data, contradicted the claim, stating that there are only six countries with an annual GDP of less than $400 million.
The six countries with a GDP lower than: 400 million were listed as Micronesia, Sao Tome and Principe, Palau, Marshall Islands, Kiribati, and Tuvalu.
The missing 22 countries that were not i: s GDP ranking were mostly territories of other nations, with only six fully independent nations without a 2013 World Bank GDP: Andorra, North Korea, Liechtenstein, Myanmar, Somalia, and Syria. However, the most recent GDP estimates for these countries all exceeded $400 million.
